identificationModule.officialTitle: Topical Ice-therapy for Pain Modulation During Intravitreal Injections: A Prospective Randomized Control Trial

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Purpose: To examine the difference in patient's pain experience in the setting of intravitreal anti-VEGF injections with pretreatment of topical ice-therapy compared with no-ice.

armGroups.label: Ice-therapy
armGroups.description: Ice therapy will be provided prior to the provision of the intravitreal injection

armGroups.label: No Ice-therapy
armGroups.description: No ice therapy will be provided prior to the provision of the intravitreal injection

interventions.name: Ice-therapy
interventions.description: Ice therapy will be provided prior to intravitreal injection provision

interventions.name: No Ice-therapy
interventions.description: No additional intervention (i.e.) ice therapy will be provided prior to intravitreal injection provision

primaryOutcomes.measure: Discomfort assessed by the visual analog scale
primaryOutcomes.description: This primary outcome measure will be surveyed using a visual analog scale to quantify discomfort from a numerical level of one to ten. A self reported rating of one represents the lowest self-reported subjective rating attributed to discomfort, while a rating of ten signifies the maximum self-reported subjective rating attributed to discomfort.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: This will be assessed at five minutes after the conclusion of the intravitreal injection

primaryOutcomes.measure: Itching assessed by the visual analog scale
primaryOutcomes.description: This primary outcome measure will be surveyed using a visual analog scale to quantify discomfort from a numerical level of one to ten. A self reported rating of one represents the lowest self-reported subjective rating attributed to itching, while a rating of ten signifies the maximum self-reported subjective rating attributed to itching.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: This will be assessed at five minutes after the conclusion of the intravitreal injection

primaryOutcomes.measure: Burning assessed by the visual analog scale
primaryOutcomes.description: This primary outcome measure will be surveyed using a visual analog scale to quantify discomfort from a numerical level of one to ten. A self reported rating of one represents the lowest self-reported subjective rating attributed to burning, while a rating of ten signifies the maximum self-reported subjective rating attributed to burning.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: This will be assessed at five minutes after the conclusion of the intravitreal injection

primaryOutcomes.measure: Overall Pain assessed by the visual analog scale
primaryOutcomes.description: This primary outcome measure will be surveyed using a visual analog scale to quantify discomfort from a numerical level of one to ten. A self reported rating of one represents the lowest self-reported subjective rating attributed to overall pain, while a rating of ten signifies the maximum self-reported subjective rating attributed to overall pain.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: This will be assessed at five minutes after the conclusion of the intravitreal injection

primaryOutcomes.description: This primary outcome measure will be surveyed using a visual analog scale to quantify discomfort from a numerical level of one to ten. A self reported rating of one represents the lowest self-reported subjective rating attributed to overall tolerability, while a rating of ten signifies the maximum self-reported subjective rating attributed to overall tolerability.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: This will be assessed at five minutes after the conclusion of the intravitreal injection

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: This will be assessed at 24-hours after the conclusion of the intravitreal injection

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* All patients aged 18 or older evaluated by a single retina specialist at the University of Minnesota Department of Ophthalmology with a clinical indication necessitating an anti-VEGF intravitreal injection

Exclusion Criteria:

* N/A
